abstract: Disney executives downplayed the severity of a strike on the company’s financial performance. “We think the network is well prepared,” Bob Iger said.
snippet: Disney executives downplayed the severity of a strike on the company’s financial performance. “We think the network is well prepared,” Bob Iger said.
lead_paragraph: Calling the Hollywood writers’ strike “just a shame,” Robert A. Iger, the chief executive of the Walt Disney Company, told analysts today in a quarterly conference call that ABC will feel the impacts of a walkout after four weeks of picketing. “It will definitely have an impact on ABC’s schedule” if a strike stretches into next month, he said.
